DataElement.preferredName: Diabetes Mellitus Oral Medication Patient Use Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to use of oral medication for the management of a disease in which the body does not properly control the amount of sugar in the blood.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Diabetes Mellitus Oral Medication Patient Use
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to use of oral medication for the management of a disease in which the body does not properly control the amount of sugar in the blood.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (dye-a-BEE-teez) A disease in which the body does not properly control the amount of sugar in the blood. As a result, the level of sugar in the blood is too high. This disease occurs when the body does not produce enough insulin or does not use it properly.:Oral; of, or relating to, or affecting, or for use in the mouth.:biologically active substance, including those intended for use in diagnosis, treatment, or prevention of disease or other abnormalities, for the relief of suffering, or control or improvement of a physical or mental state; includes biological products.

Concepts.definition: A metabolic disorder characterized by abnormally high blood sugar levels due to diminished production of insulin or insulin resistance/desensitization.
Of, or relating to, or affecting, or for use in the mouth.

A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product.

Property.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.:Use; put into service; make work or employ (something) for a particular purpose or for its inherent or natural purpose.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.
A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
